Really, any type of music is fine, just as long as I can focus on my painting. Doesn't even have to be music, either.
Hey Eru...? Could I have a fry?

condition.saying: You should visit Skyworld sometime!

case.state: Skyworld? Just the name of it already puts me at ease...
...Wait, you can walk on clouds in Skyworld?...Maybe I do wanna go there...
...You would do that? Well...that would be nice. I appreciate it.
Blow what now?
...I'm not that kind of person, but even then...How can I do it? With my feet or my head?
Green is a rather odd color...it rarely works well with most colors...but the green you're wearing? It works. it's actually quite nice.
Cu...cum...ber...Really, any word containing 'cum' is already dirty enough.
Well, of course ~player~ got to me, haven't you been paying attention?
Oh, I don't fall in love that easily. ~player~ can get to me all he wants, but they're only going to be left with more questions than answers...
...Well, I've always not had any arms...unless if ~player~ was the one that cut them off when I was younger.
Nature? Of course I like nature. Trees are the one thing I like to sit under to forget and think about things.
Why would you even need four arms anyways? Are you secretly a spider or something?
Thanks Sei. Appreciated~
...I'm not sure if you'd really want me to do that...but...I suppose I don't have anything against it if you're not.
...Doing that with you and Meia?...I don't know about that...
Mess around with paints? Well, I do that kind of thing all the time Sei, why do you ask?
...Oh? She's still in?...
...It's not over for her yet?
Wait, why is she still in?
...Oh? He's still in?...
...It's not over for him yet?
Wait, why is he still in?
You know, I ate an orange today for breakfast.
I don't remember the last time I ate an orange. Because it's annoying to peel one. It's on the list of things I want to learn properly.
Did you know I can only think of four things at the same time?
Despite me being an artist, I really don't like talking about art. It's already a way to talk without talking, so why bother talking about it?
Usually my thoughts feel like clouds. Fluffy...white...slow...
I'm trying to experience. People probably don't do this enough.
Have I told you all how much I like rain? It's like painting. It makes me feel connected.
Have I mentioned how much I love butterflies? They are the best animal.
When I was little, I didn't really have friends. Maybe it's the same now. My pens and paints were the only things that understood me.
I paint because I don't know what else I could do. It's like this feeling that there is no choice, that it's the only possibility.
I think I want to be different, sometimes. I've thought about changing myself lately, but it's a bit scary...like walking backwards with your eyes closed.
I kind of "collect" people, because they are interesting. People here really are amazing. Most of them, but not all.
You know, it wouldn't be so bad to be the sky...
...What's that one word...You know, the one about things and stuff...
This game could probably use more colors.
...People always seem to always ask, "How's life?" But they never stop to ask, "Why's life?"
Get this...People say the funniest things..when they are funny...
I feel like it's nice to moo as a cow...Probably feels really good to moo.
When you reach for the clouds...every inch counts...no matter what you do to grab it.
...I've explored the Inventory before, it's bigger than you think it is.
Some guy on the television told me that there are no mistakes, only happy little accidents. Would you think he's right?
What are clouds? I always thought they were thoughts of the sky because you can't touch them...or something like that.
Why don't they have cards in other colors other than red and black?
I wonder how the game would be played differently if more colors were used. blue Kings...yellow Aces...green Jacks...
You know, it would be cool if after you died you could see the top five times you almost died.
If coffee makes you feel hyper, why are coffee shops designed for people to chill?
If alcohol makes you feel depressed, why are bars designed for people to be more energetic?
Why do we bake cookies and cook bacon? Shouldn't it be the other way around?
There really is no evidence that today is a certain day of the week. We just have to trust that someone kept count since the first one ever.
I think someone like Lilly would know what it was like to be our heights at one point.
In a way...If our present selves are saying mean things to our past selves, then our future selves will be saying mean things about us right now.
Have you stopped to realize that both concrete and glass are mostly made of sand, which makes skyscrapers really tall sandcastles?
Hmm...If you were invisible, you could have a perfectly normal relationship with a blind person. Like Lilly for example.
It feels satisfying that after you wake up from sleeping, you won't have to face the consequences for the terrible choices you made in your dreams.
I wonder if people like Hisao are simultaneously stereotyped for not getting enough sleep and for sleeping all the time.
It's interesting to think that paintings are probably just trading cards for the rich. I wonder how much my art would be worth...
Traditions are basically a bunch of dead people peer pressuring us...
I think we're lucky that "destroying ourselves" doesn't do a lot for us the same way tickling ourselves doesn't.
I just realized...if you throw a rock into a lake. You could be the last person to ever touch that rock.
I bet the worst feeling with having hands is feeling your sleeves roll down your wrists as you wash your hands...
Has anyone ever thought about grass? It's living, it's everywhere, and you only really notice it when it's not there.
Y'know, pirates have always seemed pretty good about giving jobs to those who have disabilities.
People with anxiety are basically way too aware of being alive...
Getting a song stuck in your head wouldn't be so bad if it was the full song instead of ten seconds on loop.
Never really thought about this, but a different version of you exists in the minds of everyone who knows you.
Every child deserves parents, but not all parents deserve children.
Honestly, eating something crispy is just eating something crunchy, but it feels thin.
If tackle size was as obvious as boob size the world would be a very different place.
Eating lunch alone is pretty much torture when you're younger, but as an adult, it doesn't feel so bad.
When you choke on water, you've failed at breathing and drinking, two of the most important things you must do to live.
Emi is definitely a morning person, because she likes to run early. Though, any earlier than that would make her suspicious.
If all criminals stopped stealing, then the security industry will fail, in which case they could safely go back to stealing...
The only part of your reflection you can lick is your tongue.
If a company celebrates 365 days accident free, then they're celebrating the anniversary of the accident.
When you introduce two different groups of friends to each other, it's like your own life's crossover episode. Reminds me of when I had lunch with Lilly and Hanako as well.
It's really neat to think that nighttime is the natural state of the universe, and daytime is only caused by a nearby, burning ball of flames.
Witch hunting wouldn't have been so popular in medieval times if any of the victims were actual witches and had decided to fight back.

Water is a beverage whose flavor is its temperature.
A clear toothpaste tube would make so much sense...though, it's not that easy for me to brush my teeth anyways.
It's kinda weird how we basically have an endless mental conversation with ourselves.
The voice in your head has grown up with you and at one point was a child.
A blind person has less chance of walking into a glass door, though, I bet it wouldn't stop someone like Lilly from doing so anyways.
I think Emi could relate to this one...She has no problems wearing the same socks all day, but once they come off for one second, it’s gross to put them back on.
When you cannot sleep because you can’t stop thinking about something it’s like a single program not letting the computer shut down.
I learned that some guy died running 26 miles and now people do it for fun. Basically rubbing it in his dead face. I wonder if Emi knows anything about this guy.
When someone breaks up with you, you don't only lose your partner, but also the person you would go to tell about what just happened to you.
Our belly buttons are basically the same thing as holes in a piece of fruit, where the stem goes.

It honestly seems like introverts run on rechargeable batteries while extroverts run on solar panels.
In a way, exercising is basically hurting yourself until you build up an immunity to hurting yourself...which is why I don't do it.
If you do well in high school without having to put much effort in, that could screw you over later in life.
If it never rains on a Thursday your whole life, it's likely that you won't notice it.
Human thoughts before language must have been weird.
Holding your breath to get rid of hiccups is like turning your lungs off and on again.

If pigs could fly, their wings would probably taste really good.

No matter how old you are, an empty wrapping paper tube is still fun to bonk someone over the head with.

Being shot with an arrow is basically being long-distance stabbed.
Drinking water with a minty mouth is the cold version of spicy.
Life is considered a gift because even if you don't like it, you have to pretend you do.

If someone describes quizzes as quizzical...What do you think tests are?
When you really think about it, in order to sleep, you have to pretend to sleep.
A jailhouse and a prison are the same thing, yet a jailer and a prisoner are two different things. Why do words have to be complicated...?
People do say that life is short. Well, they're not right. It's the longest thing we experience right now.
When you give someone food, they are being fed. Though, if you give them water, they aren't being watered.
If our stomachs had thoughts, it'd probably think about why all potatoes are mashed.

We'll never know what underwater smells like.

If humans could fly, we'd consider it to be exercise and never do it. Well, it doesn't matter to me because I bet flying feels really nice.

Why is it even called a "funny bone"? It's really no laughing matter. It only feels funny...

Pretty much...our world is an ocean of air...but we just lack the ability to swim in it...
I would feel bad for anyone that's bought a soda after an earthquake...
I just learned...No matter how hard you try, you can't technically predict your next thought, because if you do, you're already thinking it.

Snakes basically kill their prey by hugging it tightly and kissing it.

One brick is good for attacking, but a lot of them is good for defending.

It's interesting that everything we know and love was all created on one planet. We probably wouldn't even exist if it weren't for the Earth.

Your age in months is really just the number of times the Moon circled you.
Interesting that we trust our bodies enough to go unconscious without the body leaving us to die without breathing.

...Try to think of another word that ends in "mt" other than the word, "dreamt".

Walking is just screwing up your balance and falling onto your other leg continuously until you actually end up somewhere.
Knocking on someone's door is just punching your room until you get attention.
There are only two days where you don't live for 24 hours. The day you're born, and the day you die.

Isn't getting healthy technically just the slowest way of dying?
Isn't your first birthday technically your second birthday?

Your alarm is tecnhically your life's theme song, since waking up is basically another episode of your life.
I think we're the only species that actually thinks that water is too boring of a beverage to survive.
When you're biting down on something, you're really biting up.

You could technically go the rest of your life without eating.
Isn't a lethal dose of something also a lifetime supply of something as well?

We often wash our clothes, but have you ever stopped to think how much we interact with things that we never wash?
This is a thought I wish to forget. When people go to a restaurant and use utensils, they've mostly been in the mouths of thousands of people before you.

Since people tend to name their pets. You'd think your pets would've named you too, if they had that same mindset, that is.

Being scared of deep waters is like being scared of heights, but in water.
If you have siblings, they are just alternate versions of what could of been you.

Erasers tend to sacrifice their lives for your mistakes.
Alarm clocks are the only objects that make you angry if they work and if they don't work.
Dying in your sleep may seem peaceful, but in a way, think of it as slipping away from reality without even knowing it.
Is blinking a plural for winking?

Are our nails just windows to our flesh? And if we paint them, are they just tinted?
If you cut off a corner of a piece of paper, it just gains another corner.

Most sea animals probably don't know that we exist.

Where do our laps go when we stand up?

As dark as it is, cannibalism solves both overpopulation and world hunger.
Most people don't even remember being born, you just take everyone else's word for it.
If you're laying down on an open field, technically, the entire Earth can be your backpack.
When you're being hugged. They are both the closest person to you and the furthest person away from you as well.

...I feel like I've been standing here for an eternity...as if time completely stopped for whatever reason.

...So this is what it feels like to be popular...

...The lack of colors on Emi...makes me feel uneasy...like being on a roller coaster out in space.

Gay? Well, I don't know about that myself. Emi though...She only sees me as a friend, and only a friend.
Hanako...Looking at you just makes me hungry for some reason...

case.state: Well, I'm alive. I'm not even sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing.
